commits.commitMessage:
[ima] Export content of ima.conf to child processes

If developers source ima.conf and then attempt to use
ima.conf defined variables in their environment (like
makefiles, etc.), their content will not be as expected.
In other words, these variables will most likely be
empty.

The reason why this is happening is because shell was not
instructed to do so. However, if 'export' keyword is used
in front of variable name, its content will be available
to child processes.

Repeating 'export' in front of every variable may not be
convenient, and it may be better to have "set -a/set +a" block
which would more or less achieve the same goal.

Resolves: LXSWIREF-600
Signed-off-by: Dragan Marinkovic <dmarinkovi@sierrawireless.com>
Change-Id: I2f5e402688cec76850a81f799cc4b4f0cdfc367b
commits.subject: [ima] Export content of ima.conf to child processes

commits.commitMessage:
Switch to SHA-256 + RSA-2048 by default & provide tests

Providing new parameters --keylength and --hash that allows to provide
the length of private keys and the strength of the digest algorithm used
for signing certificates.

Previous hardcoded setting was SHA-1 for the hash, and there was no option
for the key length (although it seems that openssl defaulted to RSA-1024).

Also providing a battery of tests that can be run through
./tests.sh

Resolves: LE-9792
Change-Id: Id0976d4ade5e2ad3bfda04f4de6e3d81d483e0a9
commits.subject: Switch to SHA-256 + RSA-2048 by default & provide tests

commits.commitMessage:
Update legato ima.config for immutable file protection

Jenkins takes ima.conf file located inside legato 3rdParty directory.
However, this file was missing SMACK configuration for immutable data
file proection, hence Jenkins build yocto image wasn't providing any
protection for those file.

Resolves: LXSWIREF-567
Change-Id: Iafca24aa4036ba326280503106ad10fd6eeb3151
commits.subject: Update legato ima.config for immutable file protection

comments.message:
Patch Set 11:

There is no bb files in this repository, this is not meant for Yocto.

Patch Set 11:

I mean, it can be used and packaged by Yocto, but by itself it has nothing to do with Yocto.

Patch Set 11:

> I mean, it can be used and packaged by Yocto, but by itself it has
 > nothing to do with Yocto.

But, they are removed from meta-swi.

Patch Set 11:

Yeah, I'm not really agreeing with the meta-swi patch as it is now.

It seems that you're doing more into the ima-support-tools recipes than just packaging these 2 scripts, so I think we could either:
- keep the recipes as this, and just remove the scripts + packaging of the scripts (which means that the scripts would not be available/provided through Yocto or the toolchain anymore)
- keep the recipes as this, remove the scripts from meta-swi but source them from another origin (I'm thinking that we could ship them to GitHub @ https://github.com/legatoproject/ima-support-tools).
Change has been successfully merged by Bertrand Roussel

commits.commitMessage:
Providing initial version of the scripts

These scripts have originally been written in meta-swi.
The following initial commit takes the script with the
following changes:
* 912fc2e ima: fix shell related problems
* cbae5c8 ima: remove obsolete kernel command line options
* 07be3f8 ima: Handle tarball path correctly
* db54356 ima: Update Legato build interface
* 5877bcc ima: Add ima-gen-keys.sh debug messages.
* 24f7cb3 ima: Enable IMA support in Yocto build system
* 9f8d072 ima: Limit privileged user scope to privileged operations
* 2f61254 ima: Fix bugs in IMA support tools
* da25ba0 ima: Add signage and key generation support

Using license MPL 2.0

Change-Id: Ib7d27b622ddbd8a7ac585e5fad406c70d5fb1d73
Resolves: LXSWIREF-509
Related: FARM-1489
Signed-off-by: Jeffrey Chien <jchien@sierrawireless.com>
commits.subject: Providing initial version of the scripts

comments.message: Please check-in these files in samples/

I don't think it's right to use SWI in there.

I was thinking about the following:

[ req ] 
default_bits = 1024 
distinguished_name = req_distinguished_name 
prompt = no 
string_mask = utf8only
x509_extensions = v3_usr
[ req_distinguished_name ]
organizationName = ACME Corp.
commonName = www.example.com
emailAddress = dev@example.com
[ v3_usr ]
basicConstraints=critical,CA:FALSE
keyUsage=digitalSignature
subjectKeyIdentifier=hash
authorityKeyIdentifier=keyid
